items.text: oh my, what a delivery that is! This is what any left-arm quick going round the wicket dreams of seeing. Perfect length, pitching on off stump and straightening past the outside edge to hit top of off. Not too much Liton could have done about it - maybe take a bigger stride forward in defence?
items.shortText: Junaid Khan to Liton Das, OUT

dismissal.text: Liton Das  b Junaid Khan 6 (16b 0x4 0x6) SR: 37.50

items.preText:
Mohammad Mithun. He shared a vital partnership with Mushfiqur in a similar situation against Sri Lanka.

Nilesh: "Junaid is back with a vengeance....Fireball"
items.text: full outside off, driven to cover point
items.shortText: Junaid Khan to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: length ball angling into middle stump, clipped towards midwicket
items.shortText: Junaid Khan to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: back of a length close to off stump, defended towards short extra-cover
items.shortText: Junaid Khan to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: ooh, Mithun was a little late spotting that change in length. Banged it in and got it to rise to just about neck height, all while angling the ball in towards off stump. Ducks quickly and just about evades it
items.shortText: Junaid Khan to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: back of a length on off stump, defended into the covers
items.shortText: Shaheen Shah Afridi to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: ooh, edged. Just a wide slip in place, though, and it flies well wide of that fielder and rolls down to third man. Back of a length, pitches outside leg and nips away from the right-hander, accentuating the angle across. Mushfiqur defends close to his body, and the extra bounce causes the ball to kiss the edge high up, near the shoulder of the bat
items.shortText: Shaheen Shah Afridi to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.text: full outside off, driven to mid-off
items.shortText: Shaheen Shah Afridi to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.preText: Shaheen's bowling with a 6-3 field. Third man and fine leg are the two men back, and there's no one at short leg
items.text: lovely length, pitching on middle and slanting away from off stump. Left alone
items.shortText: Shaheen Shah Afridi to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: ooh, opens him up completely. Again it nips away after pitching on or around leg stump, and the length leaves him rooted to the crease. Beats his edge and the batsman's right leg slides around
items.shortText: Shaheen Shah Afridi to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: overpitched outside off, but the covers are packed and he can't beat the fielder at short extra-cover with a firm drive
items.shortText: Shaheen Shah Afridi to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.preText:
Continues from round the wicket.

Kartik Sivarama: "Junaid seemed to be a placeholder for 5 years till Amir completed his ban. But overall, Junaid has much better ODI numbers esp on unhelpful UAE surfaces."
items.text: length ball angling in towards off stump, defended back to the bowler
items.shortText: Junaid Khan to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: ooh, goes wider on the crease and angles this one in. Takes a bigger stride across than he needs to to defend, and almost finds his front pad in the way as he brings his bat down. Would have struck him outside the line anyway, but
items.shortText: Junaid Khan to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: fullish, angling in towards off stump. Mushfiq reaches for the ball as he looks to drive through mid-off, plays too early, and sends it rolling to mid-on off the inside half of the bat
items.shortText: Junaid Khan to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: back of a length, angling into off and middle. Gets nicely behind it and defends it with soft hands. Ball drops down by his feet
items.shortText: Junaid Khan to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: another bouncer, rising over leg stump. Mushfiq thinks of hooking and decides late not to play the shot. Called wide for height - it did bounce over head height
items.shortText: Junaid Khan to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 wide

items.text: short again, rises over off stump at shoulder height. Mushfiq controls his pull well, keeps it down to the left of long leg
items.shortText: Junaid Khan to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.preText: Dave: "Junaid uses his angles very well whilst bowling to get wickets, whereas Amir has always relied more on swing. Maybe this explains why the latter struggles in current conditions."
items.text: length ball angling into off stump, defended towards mid-on
items.shortText: Junaid Khan to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.preText:
Shaheen from over the wicket.

Amogh K: "Okay ! Now I am really worried for India if Pakistan make it to the final. This attack now looks a potent one with a firing Junaid onboard."
items.text: again, the massed cover field protects Shaheen from the consequences of a wide half-volley. Mushfiq drives straight to cover point
items.shortText: Shaheen Shah Afridi to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: length ball, closer to off stump, defended into the covers
items.shortText: Shaheen Shah Afridi to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: back of a length, slanting away from off stump, left alone
items.shortText: Shaheen Shah Afridi to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: back of a length on middle and off, lets it come on and defends into the point region
items.shortText: Shaheen Shah Afridi to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: dug in short, gets it up to chest height but offers plenty of width, and Mushfiq gets on his toes to slash it high over point
items.shortText: Shaheen Shah Afridi to Mushfiqur Rahim, FOUR runs

items.text: back of a length on middle stump, lets it come on and defends with soft hands into the off side. Thinks of a single but Shaheen is quick to extend his follow-through and cut off that option
items.shortText: Shaheen Shah Afridi to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.preText: First bowling change. Here's Hasan Ali. A wide-ish slip in place
items.text: very full and quite wide too. Reaches out to drive and ends up slicing it down to third man
items.shortText: Hasan Ali to Mohammad Mithun, 1 run
